Method Detail

insert

public void insert(E o)
            throws IllegalArgumentException
Description copied from class: ImplementorBasedSweepArea
Inserts the given element into this SweepArea. The default implementation simply forwards this call to the underlying implementor. Thus, it calls impl.insert(o).

Specified by:
insert in interface SweepArea<E>
Overrides:
insert in class ImplementorBasedSweepArea<E>
Parameters:
o - The object to be inserted.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - Throws an IllegalArgumentException if something goes wrong with the insertion due to the passed argument.

clear

public void clear()
Description copied from class: ImplementorBasedSweepArea
Clears this SweepArea by clearing the underlying implementor. Calls impl.clear().
This method should remove all elements of a SweepArea, but holds its allocated resources.

Specified by:
clear in interface SweepArea<E>
Overrides:
clear in class ImplementorBasedSweepArea<E>

close

public void close()
Description copied from class: ImplementorBasedSweepArea
Closes this SweepArea by closing the underlying implementor. Calls impl.close().
This method should release all allocated resources of a SweepArea.

expire

public Iterator<E> expire(E currentStatus,
                          int ID)
Description copied from class: ImplementorBasedSweepArea
Determines which elements in this SweepArea expire with respect to the object currentStatus and an ID. The latter is commonly used to differ by which input this reorganization step is initiated.
If no elements qualify for removal, an empty cursor is returned and all elements are remained.
In order to remove the expired elements, either the returned iterator has to support and execute the remove operation for each expired element during traversal or the ImplementorBasedSweepArea.reorganize(Object, int) has to be overwritten to perform the final removal.

The default implementation in this class performs a sequential scan: 

        new Remover(new Filter(iterator(), removeRightBinds[ID].setRight(currentStatus)));
Hence, specialized SweepAreas should overwrite this method to gain a more efficient reorganization.

Specified by:
expire in interface SweepArea<E>
Overrides:
expire in class ImplementorBasedSweepArea<E>
Parameters:
currentStatus - The object containing the necessary information to detect expired elements.
ID - An ID determining from which input this method is triggered.
Returns:
an iteration over the elements which expire with respect to the object currentStatus and an ID.

reorganize

public void reorganize(E currentStatus,
                       int ID)
                throws IllegalStateException
Description copied from class: ImplementorBasedSweepArea
In contrast to the method ImplementorBasedSweepArea.expire(Object, int), this method removes all expired elements from a SweepArea without returning them. The default implementation removes all elements returned by a call to ImplementorBasedSweepArea.expire(Object, int).
In order to perform a more efficient removal, this method should be overwritten, e.g., by implementing a bulk deletion.

Specified by:
reorganize in interface SweepArea<E>
Overrides:
reorganize in class ImplementorBasedSweepArea<E>
Parameters:
currentStatus - The object containing the necessary information to perform the reorganization step.
ID - An ID determining from which input this reorganization step is triggered.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - Throws an IllegalStateException if this method is called at an invalid state.

toString

public String toString()
Overrides:
toString in class Object
Returns:
Returns a string representation of the sweeparea.
